runners.spotlight: £16,000 yearling; first foal; dam Hungarian 5f/5.5f winner, half-sister to winners Diligent Harry (5f/6f Listed) and Harry Three (6f Listed), out of maiden half-sister to 6f Group 2 winner Temple Meads; already been gelded and this looks a tough enough starting point.

runners.comment: £34,000 yearling; yard 20% with 2yos this season and he needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: 5,500euros foal, £34,000 yearling; seventh foal; half-brother to Polish 9.5f winner Singers Star; dam Listed-placed 1m AW winner (including 2yo; RPR 93), half-sister to Listed-placed 7f-8.5f winner Clara Peeters, out of maiden half-sister to HK 1m2f Group 1 winner Mensa; yard 20% with 2yos this season and interesting to see how he figures in market.

runners.comment: Has plenty of stamina on dam's side and he could be one for later on
runners.spotlight: 11,500euros foal, 24,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 1m5f/2m AW winner (RPR 87), half-sister to winners Leadership (UAE 7f/1m) and Blue Hue (French 9.5f/9.7f), out of Group-placed 1m-10.4f winner; has plenty of stamina on dam's side and he could be one for later on.

runners.comment: Yard 10% with 2yos last year and market should guide on debut.
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns foal; brother to 5.5f-6.5f winner Room Service (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 115), half-brother to winners Royal Advice (6f/7f; 80) and Green Clover (Polish 1m-1m2f including 2yo); dam placed 8.6f/1m1f, out of 1m4f/1m5f winner; yard 10% with 2yos last year and market should guide on debut.

runners.comment: Looks more of a middle-distance prospect on paper and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; gelded half-brother to KSA 1m2f winner Mutanather; dam unraced half-sister to winners Santa Sophia (1m4f Listed) and Sanchi (useful 1m2f/1m3f); looks more of a middle-distance prospect on paper and others are preferred.

runners.comment: One of three runners for yard and is probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 9.4f AW/1m4f turf winner (RPR 89), half-sister to useful 1m/8.4f winner Mange All, is granddaughter of Listed-placed 6f winner; one of three runners for yard and is probably best watched on debut.

runners.comment: 100-1 and she finished 7l behind Blue Orbit on Chepstow debut (6f, good) last month
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and she finished 7l behind Blue Orbit on Chepstow debut (seventh of eight) last month; opposable.

runners.comment: Down the field at a big price on Chepstow debut and was 5l behind Blue Orbit
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field at a big price on Chepstow debut last month and was 5l behind the runner-up Blue Orbit; yard runs three here and she remains best watched for now.

racecards.race_name: Download The Fitzdares App Now Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won at Kempton in October when she beat a subsequent Listed runner-up; respected on return
runners.spotlight: Gave a red-hot favourite a scare on her Kempton debut (6f, AW) in September and she justified favouritism on her return visit the following month; finished well to beat a subsequent Listed runner-up last time and she's strongly respected under a penalty on her return.

runners.comment: Signs of ability on Kempton debut last month but has lots to find on this switch to turf
runners.spotlight: Showed signs of ability at a massive price on her Kempton debut (7f, AW) last month but was 8l adrift of the winner in that race and she has lots to find on this switch to turf; passed over.

runners.comment: Tailed-off last at a massive price on her Wolverhampton debut (8.6f, AW) 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Always behind and was a tailed-off last at a massive price on her Wolverhampton debut (8.6f, AW) 11 days ago.

runners.comment: Showed promise when upped to 6f at Yarmouth and she's open to more progress; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth in her two runs this spring but she was only beaten around 3l at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) last month and that was a major step forward from her debut; this well-bred filly should continue to improve with experience and she's in the mix with Oisin Murphy booked.

runners.comment: Placed in both of her runs and latest was at Wolverhampton in April; respected
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on her Southwell debut (6f, AW) in November and she built on that with a creditable third behind an odds-on rival at Wolverhampton in April; that form puts her firmly in the picture and she's open to more progress; respected.

runners.comment: Has lots to find on the figures and handicaps look the way forward after this
runners.spotlight: Finished out the back behind Jettie's Run at Kempton in October and was down the field again on her Southwell reappearance (6f, AW) in April; has lots to find now switched to turf and handicaps will be more suitable.

runners.comment: Got detached after a slow start and was always in rear on C&D debut (80-1) last Monday
runners.spotlight: Got detached after a slow start and was always in rear on her debut over C&D (80-1) last Monday; can only be watched.

stable_tour.quote: She's starting to show up nicely at home. I think Mohaather will be a nice sire but I think they'll all need seven furlongs to a mile. Dane O'Neill said Mohaather and Battaash were two of the best horses he ever sat on. He hasn't hit the ground running, but I think this stallion will come good in the second half of the year. 04-07-24

runners.comment: The only runner who lacks experience but she needs checking in market
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 5.7f 2yo winner (RPR 70), half-sister to 7f/1m winner Golden Wedding and 1m4f winner Percy Willis; the only runner who lacks experience but she needs checking in market.

runners.comment: Shown promise in both her runs and she could have a big role to play back on turf
runners.spotlight: 7-2 when a promising second on her Salisbury debut (6f, good to firm) last summer; didn't build on that when fourth at Wolverhampton in April but that was from a tough draw and she wasn't far behind Cuban Lady; still early days and she could have a big role to play back on turf.

racecards.race_name: Fitzdares Sprint Series Handicap (Windsor Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Good third in Class 2 at Newmarket latest and he's respected on this drop back in grade
runners.spotlight: Quite a progressive sprinter on turf/AW, winning three times; suffered bad luck at Newcastle on Good Friday, then ran creditably to finish third at Newmarket (6f, good) last month; on same mark on this drop back in grade and he's respected.

quotes.race: BetMGM AWC 3 Year Old Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't expect So Darn Hot to win like that. He was essentially carrying 12lb more than last time and I wasn't sure Lingfield would suit him. He didn't have any cover, which wasn't ideal, but he's by Too Darn Hot and his progeny love a good fight - Kevin Philippart De Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: So Darn Hot has definitely sharpened up and was a bit cautious of the ground early on, but he's had no problem with that. He's very game and he felt the other horse come to him and found another gear. There'll be more to come next year. He's done really well over six months. He just wasn't there for his debut at Salisbury, but he's going from strength to strength - Benoit de la Sayette, jockey.

runners.comment: Unbeaten after two starts and he's an interesting contender now switched to a handicap
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns last May and arrives here unbeaten after wins in maiden at Ayr (5f, good) last summer and novice at Pontefract (6f, good; made all) in April; looks on fair mark now switched to a handicap and he could have a lot more to offer; interesting contender.

quotes.race: Thank You Richard Hammill Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior probably would have needed that today. He's obviously going to come on from it and he wasn't doing an awful lost in the last furlong - he had his ears pricked - but we do think he's a nice horse - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior ran green in the first two furlongs, but once I asked him he's picked up really well and won like a nice horse in the making. He does know a bit but it was his first run, he'll come on for it too and there's plenty to look forward to. I've had a couple of bits of work with him and he's always shown plenty. He's fairly laid-back and won't have harm going over further, but he has the speed. He's definitely one of the nicer ones we have, for sure - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Lightly raced but he's found things tough in two handicaps this spring; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won a Newbury novice (6f, good to firm) for the Coles last summer but he's found things tough since including in two handicaps for new yard this spring; still lightly raced and mark is sliding but others are preferred.

runners.comment: Unexposed gelding but he's not gone on since his win and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Won Down Royal maiden (5f, good) last September on the second of his three 2yo run for Jack Davison; may have needed the run on handicap/stable debut at Sandown in April but he's not gone on since his win and has bit to prove back up in trip.

runners.comment: Two novice wins on AW but he's come up short in four handicaps; down the list
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-3 when completing a Wolverhampton double (6f, AW) in November but he's come up short in four handicaps this year; mark is falling but he was beaten 8l at Newmarket last time and his turf form lags some way below his best AW efforts; down the list.

runners.breeder: K Marks,  R Goreham &  R Line
runners.comment: Won both his starts and latest was in a C&D novice last month; respected on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won at Chelmsford in sole 2yo start and he made it 2-2 when defying a penalty over C&D (good to firm) on his return last month; that was a narrow success but he held off the favourite and is open to more progress on this handicap debut; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Doncaster but he now goes back up in grade and needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Won a Bath maiden (5.7f, firm) last June; some solid efforts in handicaps since, including at Doncaster (4l second) last month, but he now goes back up in grade and needs to find more to get back on the scoresheet.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to our top sprinter Tis Marvellous and made a really good start to his career last year. He won at Bath in the summer, then ran a great race in the Super Sprint before finishing with a solid third at York. That was on soft ground, and his win had come on firm, so he's versatile. We're very happy with his work and we'll be getting cracking with him shortly. 17-04-25

runners.comment: Three 7f wins but he ran a big race over 6f on his penultimate run; dangerous back in trip
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been at 7f but he was a good second over this trip at Newcastle on AW finals day; didn't pack the same punch when fifth at Ascot (7f, good to firm) last time but he's still unexposed as a sprinter and is not ruled out back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice two-year-old who came from the breeze-ups.  He could be a nice horse later on. He'd be my dark horse. 11-07-24

runners.comment: Overall record of 1-10 and well held in three runs for new yard this spring
runners.spotlight: Ran in a couple of Group 3s for Stuart Williams late last summer before changing hands for 40,000gns; returned to handicaps for new yard this spring but he's been well held in his three runs and overall record now stands at 1-10; opposable.

runners.owner: G Doyle, K Lawrence, P Merritt & F Young
runners.comment: Eyecatcher in big field at Ascot last month and has claims if he can build on that
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated in 6f Chelmsford maiden on his seasonal return (gelded after 2yo campaign); hasn't threatened in two handicaps since but he made some late headway in big field at Ascot last month and was beaten less than 3l; has possibilities if he can build on that and his win came under Rob Hornby.

stable_tour.quote: We love him. He was coming to win at Kempton last time and jumped where the stalls were for the 1m4f race just as they quickened. Oisin Murphy said he was half a length down and he ended up being two lengths behind the winner. I didn't think he'd win on the night but Oisin is adamant he would have. He'll go to Newbury on Friday for a 6f maiden. 18-09-24

racecards.race_name: Fitzdares Telephone Betting Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Disappointing at Newbury (hurdles/Flat) in last two runs and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: 5yo who is versatile ground-wise; triple turf winner who scored at Newbury (1m2f) in October but he's been disappointing there (hurdles/Flat) in his last two runs; now drops back in grade but has bit to prove and he's still 5lb higher than for last win.

quotes.race: PMS Oxford Handicap
quotes.quote: The fact Nap Hand got a mile and a quarter on deep ground was good and although there's a slight doubt if he stays two miles over hurdles, we can come back on the Flat if it doesn't work out. It's about learning how to settle him and I'm delighted - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Sergei Prokofiev Standing At Whitsbury Manor Auction Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: James Doyle said we should stick at 6f at the minute because Nap Hand is quite a free traveller. I think he is good on this ground, but I don't think he needs it - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is improving on the Flat and won over 1m2f on heavy ground at Newbury last time. Hurdling is a possibility at a later date, he's schooled well and if he gets the trip he could be quite useful, although he'd obviously be kept to sharper tracks. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Course winner who had a near-miss off reduced mark at Kempton latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied a now smart stablemate in a Windsor novice (1m, good to firm) last June; hasn't really gone on from that in handicaps since but he had a near-miss off a reduced mark at Kempton (1m3f) last month; dictated a steady pace in that five-runner race but he could get any easy lead again and he's only 1lb higher on this return to turf; respected.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who won at Lingfield latest and is a big player again up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Made it 4-16 on turf when battling well to score at Lingfield (1m2f, good to firm) last month; up 3lb but he was as good as ever last time and two of his wins have come over C&D; big player again back at this track.

runners.comment: Won on AW latest but 4lb rise make things tougher and his last turf run was 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner but his last six wins have been on AW and latest was at Lingfield (1m2f) in April; hard to rule out another good effort but a 4lb rise makes things tougher and his last turf run was 12 months ago.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Vase Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Hitched has been a model of consistency all winter. That's his 15th run of the campaign, so he's pretty admirable, and I was delighted he was able to top it off with his best performance. Lingfield suits him best, it's just unfortunate there weren't many races there that fitted him. He probably should have been All-Weather Horse of the Year if I hadn't messed the last few runs up, but he's been a superstar. He's very sound with a great mind and he's a joy to train - David Simcock, trainer.

runners.comment: Reappeared with a close call over C&D in April and he's respected up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner who returned after seven months off with a strong-finishing second over C&D (good to firm) in April; up 3lb but he remains well handicapped on his best form and he's an interesting contender with Oisin Murphy booked.

stable_tour.quote: He has now won four of his 12 races, including last time out at Windsor earlier this month. I sent him there thinking he should be competitive but I was pleasantly surprised how easily he won. The handicapper has not been too harsh, rising him 8lb to a mark of 88 and you would hope he can win again off that. He has clearly improved from last season and this big scopey individual could have more to offer. All being well he runs next week Windsor, again over 1m2f but in a Class 3 this time. 25-05-22

racecards.race_name: Get Raceday Ready Handicap

runners.breeder: Mrs L N Harmes & Mr M Willis
runners.comment: Unplaced in eight turf runs but is effective on it; placed over 2m on AW latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner; unplaced in all eight turf starts but he is effective on it; creditable third at Lingfield (2m, AW) when last seen five weeks ago; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Bath win (11.6f, good to firm) on return in April; similar form latest; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner, the latest on his seasonal reappearance at Bath (extended 1m3f, good to firm) in April; second over the same C&D 19 days ago; each-way shout again.

quotes.race: Bresbet Rewards Loyalty Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: They went off at a gallop and Jimmy Mark needs someone to pace make for him and Callum gave him a great ride - Peter Lindsey, owner.

runners.comment: Won this race last year off the same mark; the return of blinkers looks a plus; key player
runners.spotlight: Not found his best in two runs this year but there are positives today, namely a win in the corresponding event 12 months ago off today's mark (enhanced a good course record on fast ground) and the return of blinkers; high on the list.

runners.owner: Case Racing Partnership & Anita J Lush
runners.comment: Out of sorts over hurdles this winter and fared no better back on the Flat last month
runners.spotlight: Not in much form over hurdles this winter and a return to the Flat didn't make any difference when a remote ninth at Salisbury four weeks ago (1m6f, good to firm); too much to prove.

runners.comment: 12-race maiden for whom the new trip/headgear needs to have a galvanising effect
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; ran well over 1m here on his stable debut last May but backward steps ever since; hopes pinned on the new, longer trip and the addition of blinkers (has worn a visor and cheekpieces in the past) sparking a revival.

stable_tour.quote: The handsome colt is from a lovely Ballylinch Stud family and has really pleased me in all I have asked of him. He has done some solid work and I hope to have him ready to run in the next two to three weeks. He looks alright and should be winning races this season. I think he has a future. 06-07-23

runners.breeder: S Clarke, G Parsons & A Wideson
runners.comment: C&D win off 1lb higher last September; yet to shine in two runs in 2025 but can't dismiss
runners.spotlight: C&D win off 1lb higher last September; only fifth in her two runs this year but she's capable at this level if back to her best.

runners.comment: AW win in April and two solid efforts have followed; best turf run came here; contender
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 17th attempt when winning a 1m4f handicap at Wolverhampton in April; just missed out at Southwell one week later and better than the bare result back at Southwell 33 days ago; only turf effort of note came at Windsor so don't rule out a big run.

runners.comment: 1m4f AW win last summer; lacklustre reappearance but should fare better today
runners.spotlight: Her win came on AW but she has run to a similar level on turf; lacklustre seasonal return at Bath six weeks ago but could prove a different proposition with that run behind her.

runners.comment: Yet to make a splash in handicaps; easy enough to swerve after 235 days off
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field AW novice (1m) in November 2023, her second start; she has started at 22-1 or bigger for each of her eight handicap runs and hasn't made much of an impact; opposable after 235 days off.

runners.comment: Bath win last spring off 4lb higher; back from a break and likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Won at Bath last spring off a 4lb higher mark (similar trip, good ground); retained ability on AW over the winter and although his latest run wasn't his best, it was over a trip that looked to stretch him; absent for 135 days and likely best watched.

runners.breeder: Sir P Vela, Triermore Stud & New England
runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner but yet to show much in six turf starts
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner but he hasn't finished within 15l of the winner in six turf starts; hard to recommend.

racecards.race_name: Fitzdares Handicap

runners.comment: Has been up and down in handicaps and was quiet on reappearance in April; down the list
runners.spotlight: Won a three-runner Pontefract maiden (1m, soft) last May, but mixed bag since going handicapping; ended last season with a good third off 2lb higher at Newcastle but he reappeared with a laboured effort at Chelmsford in April (first run since gelded); may have needed that run but he's now 1-9 and others are more solid.

quotes.race: Fleet Finders Supports The National Horseracing College EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Danny [Tudhope, jockey] said Savvy Exchange was a bit green when he hit the front, he's not been on grass much. He's a big unit and he'll come on a lot. He's a work in progress and will keep improving - Sean Woods, trainer.

runners.comment: Inconsistent 10-race maiden and she needs to find more back at this trip; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for Peter Chapple-Hyam and 0-3 this year for current yard; on dangerous mark and was runner-up at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) in March but she didn't match that back on turf at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) last time; tongue-tie is now added and she needs to find more back at this trip.

runners.comment: Two turf wins last July and latest was over C&D; needs a close look back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins on fast ground last July and latest was over C&D; down the field on her Kempton reappearance in April but that was a Class 4 and she may have needed the run; now drops back in grade and she needs a close look on this return to turf.

quotes.race: Download The Fitzdares App Now Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Atlantis Blue used to be quite headstrong but I managed to drop her in and she's learning her trade. She's well handicapped and seems to be going forward - Jim Crowley, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Last win was in August 2023 and he's been well held on Tapeta and turf last twice
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner but his last success was in August 2023; returned to form with a close call at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) in October but diminishing returns since and was only fourth of five on his Bath reappearance (1m, firm) last month; others preferred.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: We're absolutely delighted with Island Bandit. I knew he was in great form and had a good feeling about today. When I saw his ears pricked in front I knew it was a good sign. He won three races in a row last year and he's the sort of horse I could see doing that again. I just need to choose the right races. The Sunday Series is a fantastic initiative. The races are very competitive but the prize-money is excellent - Heather Main, trainer.

quotes.race: Crossland Employment Solicitors Handicap
quotes.quote: I know Island Bandit has got tons of ability, but he has tested my patience. The headgear worked, but I probably should have put them on earlier. We tried to give him every chance, but he just needed sharpening up and we resorted to them. He's a chilled-out character and just needed a bit of help. Hollie said we could drop back to seven and make lots of use of him - Heather Main, trainer.

runners.comment: Added to his four AW wins when scoring over C&D nine days ago; big player again up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 31211232131 since last July and his last success was over C&D (good) nine days ago; that was his first win on turf but he's only 2lb higher today and is a major player again.

prev_owners.owner: Roldvale Ltd, W Salthouse & E Babington

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo and he needs watching in market on stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden but he had a near-miss in a Newcastle handicap (1m) on his penultimate run last season; left George Boughey for 14,000gns in the autumn; returns after 230 days off but he still has potential and needs watching in market on stable debut.

runners.comment: Five-time turf winner but he's been out of sorts this spring; needs big turnaround
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins, the most recent at Bath (1m, good) last September; now 2lb lower than for that success but he's a frequent slow starter and has been out of sorts in two runs this season; has something to prove and he needs a big turnaround.

racecards.race_name: Today's Gate Sponsored By The INPBA Fillies Maiden

runners.comment: Promise both runs last year including here, 1m should suit, yard in form, chance; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Rated 77; best effort in two starts last year came second time out at Dundalk (closely matched with Dancing Teapot); promise on debut here over 7f (good); dam won an Argentinian Group 1 so should appreciate this trip and her yard is in flying form; considered in first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: 66-1 and well beaten on debut, new yard had big priced winner last week, best watched
runners.spotlight: Cracksman filly was 66-1 and never landed a blow on debut for Matthew Smith last July; best watched after absence on debut for new yard (had a big priced winner at Down Royal last week).

runners.comment: Rated 80, closely matched with Chocalho, improve for return, up in trip a plus, chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 80 after three starts; runner up twice at Dundalk last year (closely matched with Chocalho on second run); should improve for comeback in a 7f Curragh handicap and will appreciate the extra furlong here; wide draw not ideal but obvious chance on form.

runners.comment: Ghaiyyath filly, 33-1 and just minor promise here on debut, drops in trip, more needed
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; Ghaiyyath filly sent off at 33-1 for debut here over 9.5f and just showed a glimmer of promise; drops back in trip; needs a fair bit more to be competitive in this company.

runners.comment: Home-bred Camelot filly, stamina in pedigree, hooded for debut, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Home-bred Camelot filly is a second foal; half-sister to 1m6f/2m winner Reel Her In (RPR 66); dam 1m4f Flat (81) and smart 2m-2m4f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Callthebarman (useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase) and Rosewin (1m4f-2m); hooded for debut and may need further in time; check the market.

runners.comment: Rated 80, shaped like 1m would suit here on latest, drawn wide but should go well
runners.spotlight: Rated 80 after four starts; Starspangledbanner filly ran a nice race on seasonal return here over 9.5f (good); drop back to 1m will suit on the evidence of that effort; should go well.

runners.comment: Well beaten on debut at 100-1 eight days ago, looks more of a long-term project
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and never figured on debut at the Curragh eight days ago; looks more of a long-term project.

runners.comment: Debut C&D run not totally devoid of promise, more needed to be competitive here
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; Kodi Bear filly's debut run over C&D wasn't totally devoid of promise but she was still beaten 9l; needs to find plenty of improvement to be competitive here.

runners.comment: 22-1 and beaten 23l on debut, half-sister to Snellen so could do better, check market
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 22-1 and beaten 23l on debut at the Curragh last September; Blue Point filly is a half-sister to the yard's very useful filly Snellen so should do better at some stage; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Long odds and no impact first two starts, cheekpieces removed, opposable
runners.spotlight: Long odds and no show in first two starts; cheekpieces worn last time removed; oppose.

runners.comment: Triple-figure odds and well-beaten all three starts, may do better when sent handicapping
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds all three starts and has run accordingly; may be seen to better effect when sent handicapping.

runners.comment: 28-1 and finished last of seven on debut at Sligo over 6f, hard to fancy after that effort
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; 28-1 and finished last of seven on debut at Sligo (6f, good), always in rear; steps up in trip but hard to fancy after that effort.

runners.comment: Promise over 6f on debut, not as good over 1m latest, watch on seasonal return
runners.spotlight: Wasn't disgraced on debut at the Curragh (6f, soft) in October when 50-1 but never better than midfield when 125-1 over 1m there in November; best watched on seasonal return.

runners.comment: Rated 75, highly tried after debut, went close in 7f maiden here in April, place chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 75 after seven starts; highly tried to no avail after debut third behind Lake Victoria; touched off back in a maiden here (7f, soft) on seasonal return in April; carried head awkwardly when beaten 6.5l upped to 1m at Leopardstown latest (good); place claims but needs more to win.

racecards.race_name: KCLR 96FM Apprentice Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: 0-17, low-key first two runs for this yard, beaten 7l off this mark on Friday
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in fifteen starts for Eve Johnson Houghton; low-key start for this yard; beaten 7l at Down Royal off this mark on Friday; this easier but others hold more pressing claims.

runners.comment: 9yo had a fine summer last year, 6lb above last win, may need this run and softer ground
runners.spotlight: 9yo mare enjoyed a fine summer last year, racking up form figures of 2311 before a below par ninth of 16 on final start at Galway; lacks a run, is 6lb above last winning mark and prefers softer ground.

quotes.race: Galway Handicap
quotes.quote: Pimstrel ran well in Killarney first time and was just touched off at Gowran when the ground was just a bit quick. She wears her heart on her sleeve - Laura Hourigan, trainer.

quotes.race: Rose Hotel Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Pimstrel is very honest for a low-grade filly and likes this soft ground. We will keep her busy as long as she holds her form - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Supporting The Irish Jockeys Fund Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Pimstrel has shown us plenty on the gallops at home last year and we decided to give her one more try this year and put cheekpieces on her. Leigh gave her a brilliant ride and the cheekpieces have worked. She's decided to do what she's capable of doing - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.breeder: A Anghert, N Saltiel & Salibi Racing
runners.comment: Best run for some time on seasonal return and stable debut, chance if builds on that
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden on his third trainer; ran a pleasing race on his seasonal return and stable debut at Cork (10.5f, good) in first time blinkers (retained); down 1lb for that and dropped in trip; chance if builds on that.

runners.comment: Ran well at Naas on penultimate, 2lb lower now, excuses latest, chance if repeats Naas run
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner yet to score on turf after 27 starts; ran well at Naas on penultimate (1m, yielding) when a 1l third of 20; upset in stalls and beaten favourite over this C&D latest (good); chance if reproducing that Naas effort off 2lb lower.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.owner: Mrs Helen Butler & Gerard P O'Neill

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Anne Gleeson & Mrs Helen Butler

runners.comment: 3-28, pleasing return at Roscommon, strip fitter, placed here off higher marks, go well
runners.spotlight: 3-28 on turf but without a win since 2023; shaped promisingly on return to action at Roscommon last month; strip fitter for that and has run well here before off higher marks; should go well.

quotes.race: @Tipperaryraces Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Jazz Dreamers was a cheaply bought horse. The plan was not to make it but he broke so well and Andy let him roll on. If you're going to get 1m1f it will be around here. We'll find something similar - Seamus Fahey, trainer.

runners.owner: J Leigh & J O'Rourke & Teresa Leigh & Jenny Curley
runners.comment: Two time winner, well-treated on old form but hasn't looked a winner in waiting recently
runners.spotlight: Two-time turf winner but those wins came in 2023 on soft-heavy ground; is well-handicapped on old form but hasn't looked a winner in waiting on recent starts; others preferred.

quotes.race: O'Neill & Co. Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asisaid got his ground today and the blinkers helped. When he goes and does it he has plenty of ability. With the ground as it is we might go to Galway - Pat Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: ITBA Next Generation Handicap
quotes.quote: Asisaid was a bit backward physically and mentally. We're delighted with that, we knew he'd do a job but we just didn't think he do it as quickly. He came to hand very quick this year - Pat Murphy, trainer.

runners.comment: 8lb below last win but out of form in two runs for this yard, needs to find improvement
runners.spotlight: Won two for Mark McNiff at Sligo and Bellewstown in 2023; is 8lb below that last win but has struggled in first two starts for Noel Kelly; needs to find improvement.

runners.comment: Won here in April, struggled off revised mark since, beaten 18l latest, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won well over C&D (yielding) in April off 46; struggled off revised mark in three runs since, including when beaten 18l here latest; others preferred.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Top Of The Pops was really determined to win. He battled very well and was quite impressive on this heavy ground. He's a typical horse from Mark Johnston's stable - once he got his head in front he just kept fighting. He was very professional and the further he goes, the better he will be - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D F O'Rourke & Mrs Josephine Hogan & Denis F Howard

runners.comment: 0-13, went close off 9lb higher here last July, slow away latest, visor on, outrun odds
runners.spotlight: 0-13; best effort came over 7f here last July when beaten 0.5l off 55; 9lb lower now and ran better than the bare result over C&D latest (slow away); could outrun likely odds in first-time visor if breaks better, though draw not ideal.

runners.comment: 3yo is 0-9, best form on AW, struggled back on turf latest, others arrive in better form
runners.spotlight: 3yo maiden has shown her best form at Dundalk; ran well for a close fourth there in March but struggled returned to turf at Tipperary; others arrive in better form.

prev_owners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
Ms E L Banks And R L Banks

runners.comment: AW winner, 0-5 on turf, went close here on heavy on penultimate (7f), needs rain
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-5 on turf; went close over 7f here (heavy) in April when beaten a head off 44; struggled on good ground off 3lb higher latest at Roscommon; needs rain.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him back as I think he can keep improving. I wasn't particularly overwhelmed with his first run but I think he's not taken the cold winter as well as some of the other horses in the yard. He's not quite come to himself and we'll see how he goes on the grass, but I could see him taking a big step forward as he just strengthens up. 29-03-24

runners.comment: AW winner, has won two here, strip fitter for latest, wide draw, could stay on for place
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 2-31 on turf, both wins coming here at 7f (good) and 9.5f (heavy); always behind on return here in April (7f, heavy); should strip fitter for that and is 4lb below her last win; drawn wide and hard to fancy for win purposes but could run on late for a place.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Leading Jockey & Trainer Championship Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Lisabetta is a consistent little filly and hasn't run a bad race all year. I'm delighted she ran so well here and we'll be back again as she hasn't had a tough campaign so far - Tim Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Goresbridge Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I actually told Tim to step Lisabetta up in trip because I thought that trip was a bit sharp. She was very genuine and game and I got into a nice position from the draw. She stuck at it well. Leigh (Roche) actually helped me as she was half running around when I delivered my challenge. She will improve when she goes up in trip. It wasn't a great race but I think she'll win again - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.comment: 0-18, ran well off 70 on return last year, nicely drawn, could go well at a price
runners.spotlight: Eighteen-race maiden is 0-7 on turf; well beaten final two starts of 2024 at Dundalk; lacks a run but yard is in decent form and he did go well on seasonal return off 70 last year at Fairyhouse (7f, good); nicely drawn and could go well at a price.

runners.comment: 2-33 on turf, out of form this season, beaten 13l in claimer latest, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Veteran is 2-33 on turf; mostly poor form last season and hasn't been great this term either; beaten 13l in a Tipperary claimer latest; mark falling rapidly but hard to fancy right now.

quotes.race: Ornella Underwriting Ltd Equine And Bloodstock Insurance Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Magic Charm is a genuine horse but the blinkers maybe just helped him travel. He ran a savage race last day and we knew today that the stiff track and soft ground would help him - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Welcomes Racing TV Members Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Magic Charm had a good solid run the last day and has proved to be competitive at this level before today. All the conditions were right so we were hopeful -Natalia Lupini, trainer

runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, mild promise at Dundalk but didn't back it up latest, 6lb wrong, oppose
runners.spotlight: Thirteen race maiden is 0-7 on turf on the Flat; mild promise off basement mark when fourth at Dundalk in April but didn't back it up on latest; 6lb wrong and others preferred.

runners.comment: Maiden but running well this season, visor goes on, 1llb wrong, place chance down in trip
runners.spotlight: Long standing maiden has run well in three of four starts this season; was a shade unlucky at Leopardstown  (7f, good) when beaten 2l in April; another good effort at Cork (10.5f, good) latest; visor goes on; 1lb wrong but place chance dropped back in trip.

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Gowran Classic

runners.comment: Course maiden winner, trip should suit, others better suited by the race conditions
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin maiden winner over a furlong shorter on heavy ground at this track on his fifth and final start last season; disappointing on return in the 7f Madrid Handicap (4-1 favourite) at Naas; more like it when fourth over 1m at the same venue last time; trip should suit; cheekpieces fitted; others better suited by the race conditions.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Viking Invasion improved a lot for stepping up in trip. It was just a bit sharp for him the last day. He handles this ground and quickened up well. He's a colt with plenty of potential and hopefully can keep on improving - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider

runners.owner: Nigel O'Hare/D W Sloan/Milena C Mocchetti/Kabin Racing Synd
runners.comment: Placed in five of his seven starts, 74-rated gelding is badly off at the weights
runners.spotlight: Placed in five of his seven starts, twice on turf in Britain, twice when runner-up for this stable at Dundalk last December, and when second in a 1m maiden here 12 days ago; 74-rated gelding is badly off at the weights.

runners.comment: Decent juvenile form, not as good this season, trainer has stronger candidates
runners.spotlight: Won a Tipperary maiden last September and ran respectably in a French Group 3 next time; below that since level, including in handicaps; trainer has stronger candidates.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dignam is a grand, solid horse. He has a good turn of foot and has a bit of quality about him - Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Group 3-winning juvenile, has been highly tried this term, big chance here if she stays
runners.spotlight: 3-8 at two; won valuable Ballyhane Stakes at Naas and the 7f Group 3 Weld Park Stakes; met trouble in Breeders' Cup Juvenile Fillies' won by stablemate Lake Victoria; flopped in the Dubai Duty Free Stakes on return; out of her depth in the Pouliches; big drop in class now; up in trip, leading chance if she stays; positives in the pedigree.

quotes.race: Weld Park Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Heavens Gate quickened well from a patient ride. She has had some very good runs and deserved that. She could possibly go to America - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Ballyhane Stakes (Median Auction Race)
quotes.quote: Heavens Gate is such a lovely filly. Ryan has always said she wants to go up to seven so that's what we'll do now. She's very straightforward, kind and relaxed, and she was doing her best work at the end. She's happy to make her own running or take a lead, it doesn't matter to her and she's very comfortable on all ground as well. It's rare to get one so straightforward - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Albany Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Heaven's Gate ran a stormer. We thought she was a good filly - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was a Group 3 winner last season and we'll train her for a Guineas and see where we go. She's ready to start and will go for one of the trials at the Curragh, Leopardstown or Newbury. 07-04-25

runners.comment: Consistent sort but needs to raise his game to win a race of this standard
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Roscommon at two and has kept good company since; consistent sort but needs to raise his game to win a race of this standard.

stable_tour.quote: He contested a smart race at Cork last weekend and just got sucked into it a bit early but did well to finish third. He'll probably go up in distance for a winners' race at Roscommon. He won his maiden there last year so it looks a suitable spot for him. 24-04-25

prev_owners.owner: Cunningham Thoroughbreds & Thomas P O'Brien & V Zhdanov

runners.comment: Useful juvenile form including fifth to Heavens Gate at Naas, well below best on return
runners.spotlight: Beat the talented Rough Diamond in a maiden at Leopardstown last July; fair fifth of 21 behind today's rival Heaven's Gate in the Ballyhane Stakes at Naas; ended the season on a good note with second behind the Ballydoyle-trained Whirl over 1m at the Curragh; a long way below that form on reappearance in the Athasi Stakes at the same venue.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: And So To Bed is a filly we have like all along, we probably ran into two very good sorts at the Curragh. The trip suited and she seemed to like going around a bend - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She progressed nicely last season and finished off in good style when runner-up in a Group 3 at the Curragh. She's also probably going to start back in the Athasi as well. She likes a bit of soft ground and is a nice filly. 24-04-25

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Confirmed a liking for this track and trip with a comfortable recent success, progressive
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a close-up fourth in a C&D maiden; won a C&D fillies' maiden on last month's return, getting the better of a well-bred Ballydoyle runner; confirmed a liking for this track and trip with a comfortable success in a fillies' event 12 days ago; progressive sort.

quotes.race: @gowranpark1 On Twitter Fillies Race
quotes.quote: It took me all of last year to get to know how to ride Deressa, she enjoys a nice pace and to be coming at them. I would be happy enough with that trip but she'll get further in time. She enjoyed that ground, she's a filly that is improving away, a typical Aga Khan pedigree - Chris Hayes, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.comment: Course 7f winner at two, highly tried on occasions, has plenty to prove at this stage
runners.spotlight: Course 7f maiden winner on debut, beating Dignam; has failed to build on that form; highly tried on occasions, but has plenty to prove at this stage; met some trouble in a 7f Curragh handicap on latest.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's always good when they win here first time out. Nancy J has always been very professional at home and she seems to do her work easy. I had a nice draw, I winged the gates and I slipstreamed Dylan [Browne McMonagle] all the way. She picked up like she was going to go away and win well but she had a good look and was quite green. She should improve loads and she's a nice prospect - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden first time out at Gowran Park. We ran her in the big Goffs race over six furlongs at the Curragh in September and she just got no luck in that. She was entered in a Group race at Leopardstown a few weeks ago but wasn't quite there yet. She's going to be a smart filly this season over seven furlongs or a mile. 23-04-25

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Middle-distance winner at Dundalk, appeared not to stay in a 1m5f Listed race at Navan
runners.spotlight: Third in 1m Dundalk maiden on debut (form franked) in January, finishing from well off the pace; different tactics employed when a ready winner from the front over the extended 1m2f at the same venue in April; appeared not to stay in a 1m5f Listed race at Navan last month.

runners.comment: Won well over 1m here 12 days ago, still looked raw and can improve, trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Well supported on debut in a maiden over an extended 1m2f at Cork early last month and found only one too good; built on that with a fairly straightforward front-running win over 1m here 12 days ago; still looked raw and can improve; return to longer trip should help.

quotes.race: Gowran Park Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: The plan was to keep it simple, Inventress travelled well but changed her legs a bit and is still quite green. She won comfortable, I thought it was a good performance. She will probably want a bit more give in the ground, she'll improve a lot. She could easily go back up to 1m2f - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.comment: Won the valuable EBF Auction Series Final over 7f at Naas last year, faces tough task here
runners.spotlight: Won the valuable EBF Auction Series Final over 7f at Naas last year; in rear in a Group 3 Curragh event in which And So To Bed was second; down the field in a handicap on reappearance; 74-rated filly faces very tough task in this company.

racecards.race_name: KCLR 96FM Apprentice Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Five-time AW winner, turf maiden, not disgraced last three starts, down in grade, chance
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner yet to score on turf but has run respectably in defeat; third twice off 65 at the Curragh over 7f in April-May but only seventh over 7f at Listowel yesterday.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: El Bello was tough all the way to the line. Two horses came alongside him and he battled well. You'd like to think he could get an extra furlong - Dan King, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced gelding, things are really starting to click with him now. He won back-to-back races at Wolverhampton and Newcastle, both over 7f. He went up a fair bit to 80 from an opening mark of 71 - the handicapper actually hiked him 8lb for his last win at Gosforth Park. He relished the stiff 7f there and although he won at Wolverhampton I was not sure the track suited him, and my fears were proved correct last week when he was never happy and although he ran on well at the end it is not his course. We will keep him to stiffer venues in the future and he can win again. 25-05-22

runners.owner: Hugh J O'Brien & Loughlin Flynn & J B Tolan

prev_owners.owner: Hugh J O'Brien & Mrs Pauline McCourt & Loughlin Flynn
Hugh J O'Brien & Mrs Pauline McCourt

runners.comment: Four time winner on turf, best at Bellewstown, ran okay here latest but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner on turf, all those wins coming at Bellewstown; ran okay here over 9.5f (soft) latest and this an easier race but she's drawn wide and others make more appeal.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: The Bog Bank is tough as nails. She just loves the game. She ran crackers at Bellewstown and just ran into one the first day. She tries every time and is always thereabouts - James Ryan, rider

runners.comment: In-form, won off 57 on penultimate, beaten off revised mark latest, down 2lb, place chance
runners.spotlight: In-form mare gained second turf win at Roscommon (7.5f, good) last month by a nose off 57; raised 4lb and beaten 4l in follow up bid at the same track; well-drawn and place chance off 2lb lower.

runners.comment: Won four for Lucinda Russell, off since last August, best watched on return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Started career with this stable; won four for Lucinda Russell including two on turf at Hamilton on good and soft ground; off since August 2024 and is 1lb above last win; probably best watched on return for this yard.

runners.comment: Won by 6l off 53 for former yard, 3lb higher now, will like the ground, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m1f Hamilton handicap by 6l for Micheal Dods last August off 53; just 3lb higher now after two below par runs for this stable; capable of better and will like the ground; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He's basically what you see. He won at Hamilton off 53 in early August over 1m1f and then went back over 1m2f at Ayr. He ran okay but I'm tempted to pull him back a furlong or two now and see how he copes. He's rated 60 and is capable off his current mark. 28-08-24

runners.comment: Heavy ground hurdles winner, not a bad run latest, down 2lb and in trip, needs more to win
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose hurdles winner on heavy ground; 0-7 on the Flat on turf; not beaten far at Cork (10.5f, good) last month off 58; 2lb lower now and worth a go at this shorter trip but needs more to win.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to run Metamorpheus in the Boodles provided he sneaks in. 25-02-23

runners.comment: 0-10, hasn't looked like winning in five starts for this yard, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in five starts for Clive Cox and hasn't threatened to shed the maiden tag in five runs for this yard; handicapper slow to relent; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Seven time AW winner, 15lb below last turf win but hard to fancy on recent form
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner is just 1-14 on the grass; not a bad run at Cork on penultimate but well below that level on latest at the Curragh; is now 15lb below his last win but he's hard to fancy on recent form.

runners.comment: Handicap debutante, mild promise in maidens, could improve, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; mild promise in first two maidens last Autumn at 7f-1m; 200-1 and beaten 27l over this C&D on return last month; related to useful winners so could improve; check the market.

runners.comment: Two-time course winner at 7f in 2023, lost form since, no signs of revival latest, oppose
runners.spotlight: Two-time course winner over 7f in 2023; has lost her way since and no signs of a revival in two runs this season; passed over.

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The Fog Horn likes it here and likes a bit of better ground. It was a little bit too soft for her the last day and James gave her a great ride out in front today from a good draw. We'll see what the handicapper does, he gave her 12lb the last time she won which was plenty so we claimed off her today which made a difference - Seamus O'Donnell, trainer.

runners.comment: 1-25 on turf, has finished second the last twice, well-drawn, should be thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-25 on turf on the Flat; has returned in fine fettle this season, finishing second at Sligo (6f, good) and Roscommon (7.5f, good); nicely drawn and should be thereabouts again.

runners.comment: 0-17 on turf, ran well here last year, shaped ok latest, place chance off 3lb lower
runners.spotlight: 0-17 on turf; went close here in October off 47 on heavy ground; shaped with a bit of promise on seasonal return at Roscommon (7.5f, good), staying on from the back; place chance off 3lb lower if building on that.

runners.comment: Went close here off this mark on return, not as good latest, could bounce back; visored
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf; beaten just 0.75l over C&D (good) on seasonal return off this mark; not as good at Roscommon latest in cheekpieces which are now replaced by a visor; could go well back at this venue.

runners.comment: 4-38 on turf, no win since 2023, good run here in April, well-handicapped, drawn wide
runners.spotlight: 4-38 on turf but without a win since September 2023; is well-handicapped on old form and has run well here before, including when a 4.5l third here in April, but has a wide draw to overcome here.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit won here last year and I hoped coming back here would work. She ran away with him down the hill but Jamie gets on well with her, that's his fourth win on her - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN The Advantage Series Handicap
quotes.quote: During the summer jockeys were saying Dazzling Spirit needed a little bit further but she just wouldn't let herself down on the ground. On the soft she's letting herself down and she's getting quicker, that's why I took a chance coming back to seven. At home she's very speedy and her half-sister Powersville was a five or six-furlong mare. She'll go to Galway now for a seven-furlong handicap and that might see her out for the season - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit got a lovely run up the rail. She travelled well and hit the line well, she was still a bit green and ran around a bit. She was a bit unlucky last time but she enjoyed herself today - Jamie Powell, rider.

runners.comment: Maiden, 0-12 on turf, promise on penultimate, drawn widest and mark due to drop 5lb
runners.spotlight: 0-28 overall and 0-12 on turf; ran well at Roscommon on penultimate (7.5f, good); soft ground may not have suited in Tipperary claimer latest but mark due to drop 5lb, drawn widest and others make more appeal.

racecards.race_name: QuinnBet Handicap

runners.comment: Three of his four wins were gained early in the 2023 season, on a long losing sequence
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins were gained early in the 2023 season; on a long losing sequence now; new headgear combination after a satisfactory run at Leopardstown on seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Women's Irish Network For Racing Lady Riders Handicap
quotes.quote: Burren Song likes to be let stride along like that, we were probably riding him wrong by holding him up. Since we've let him use his stride he seems to be a bit better. I'd like to put him over two miles, I think he'll be better at two miles, and he might go to the GPT at Galway - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.comment: Prolific AW winner for David Simcock, made a pleasing start for this yard over 1m at Cork
runners.spotlight: Completed an AW five-timer for David Simcock in early 2024 and continued to run well before adding a further AW success at Southwell in October (1m); made a pleasing start for this yard when third over 1m at Cork; tackles a new trip now.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was just very hard work from the turn in, you can't really paint it any other way. Fortunately Lough Leane has got the job done. He was off a little while, came back, won his race, and he's managed to follow up, so he was probably entitled just to feel the pinch a little - Callum Shepherd, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: His owners, the Twenty Stars Partnership, have been lucky for us. He's always shown very little at home - hence we probably got the trip very wrong during his three-year-old campaign. He jarred himself up on fast ground and he's come back much more comfortable in 2024. He ran up a nice sequence on the all-weather, winning a nice bonus, and he's been very consistent. We'll hopefully find him another race before the end of the turf season. He handles a bit of juice in the ground and arguably his best race was at Yarmouth on soft ground, so that's the sort of thing we'd be looking at. 04-09-24

runners.comment: Four-time winner, needs to step up on the form of two races over longer trips this season
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner; needs to step up on the form of two races over longer trips this season; finished behind Migdam at Ballinrobe last time.

quotes.race: SBK Betting Podcast Handicap
quotes.quote: Nostra Casa doesn't like being boxed in and obviously with the draw it was hard to get out. He probably likes a bit heavier ground. We will try and get into Galway this year, we missed the cut last year - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.comment: Looked a shade unlucky when beaten a neck at Roscommon and can be fancied to feature
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m at this venue last season; looked a shade unlucky when beaten a neck at Roscommon on second start this season, took a while to get a clear passage and finished well; can be fancied to feature.

runners.owner: Don't Let The Old Man In Syndicate
runners.comment: Only a debut maiden win to her name but running well enough to suggest she could go close
runners.spotlight: Only a debut maiden win to her name but running well enough to suggest she could go close; not beaten far in fourth at Sligo last month.

quotes.race: Finlay Volvo Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Money Dancer behaved herself better here than she does at home, she's very bouncy and not simple. But she has always shown us plenty. She has been tipping along all winter but we liked the couple of pieces of work she did. She found plenty and handled the trip well. We will roll the dice a bit with her now. With those fillies, you are as well off to get what you can when you can with them, so we will go for a Listed race somewhere - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Versatile sort ran well to take third in adverse circumstances at Cork, definite chance
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose winner who goes on any ground; has run respectably in stronger races at Cork this season; 4lb out of the handicap last time, harmed his chance by starting slowly and then racing keenly; stayed on well near the finish; strong contender in this grade.

runners.comment: Two wins in 2023, off for almost two years before a moderate run at Ballinrobe last month
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins for George Boughey in 2023; off for almost two years before a moderate run at Ballinrobe last month.

runners.comment: Deserved his maiden hurdle win at Killarney after a couple of promising runs, interesting
runners.spotlight: Deserved his maiden hurdle win at Killarney after a couple of promising runs, including at Clonmel when his rider had to cope with a slipped saddle; interesting on his early-career form for Andre Fabre.

runners.comment: Winning favourite at Dundalk in April, needs to bounce back from disappointing Sligo run
runners.spotlight: Winning favourite over this trip at Dundalk in April; needs to bounce back from a disappointing Sligo run that leaves her with plenty to find with fourth-placed Money Dancer.

runners.comment: Wins for Jane Chapple-Hyam were on soft and heavy ground, stays this far,  Irish debut
runners.spotlight: Wins for Jane Chapple-Hyam were on soft and heavy ground, over 1m2f and 1m4f; ran well on his final run for that yard before changing hands for 8,000gns; absent since last July.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Eyetrap was fresh and went through the testing ground. He battled well and stayed the trip nicely - Marco Ghiani, jockey.

runners.comment: Worth another shot at this trip which she tried for the first time when fourth on latest
runners.spotlight: A big improver last year, winning three handicaps, including over an extended 1m3f; worth another shot at this trip which she tried for the first time when fourth at Roscommon three weeks ago.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Barrogstown Girl battled very well in fairness to her. I was a little bit worried about her bouncing two days after her last run, and about the draw, but Neve said she was game out. She's a very honest little filly - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Panoramic Restaurant At Limerick Racecourse Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Barrogstown Girl was racing lazy early and got a bit detached. I said to Neve to try and get her home over the trip and don't go after her until you get over the top of the hill. In fairness, she got her going in time and she came home nicely - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: Has a better record on AW but last Friday's Fairyhouse fourth provides some encouragement
runners.spotlight: Has a better record on AW (3-13) than on turf (1-13) but last Friday's 1m2f Fairyhouse fourth provides some encouragement.

runners.owner: Mrs Marguerite Bolger & Mrs J S Bolger
runners.comment: Found 6f inadequate at the Curragh on seasonal debut, this trip could stretch her stamina
runners.spotlight: Found 6f inadequate at the Curragh on seasonal debut; in contrast, this trip could stretch her stamina; has finished second in two  maidens, heavy ground both times.

runners.comment: Beaten favourite at Roscommon two weeks ago, appears well held by runner-up Action Plan
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort; won a Limerick maiden hurdle (2m, good) in April; won her final Flat start last year at Bellewstown (1m4f, yielding) off 64; beaten favourite at Roscommon two weeks ago, appears well held by runner-up Action Plan but may find her form again with cheekpieces fitted.

runners.comment: Won a maiden over 1m at Limerick in April, an unknown quantity over this trip
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden over 1m at Limerick in April, an unknown quantity over this trip; has been placed in two of her races at this venue, and not beaten far in fourth here in April.

runners.comment: Only one win from 22 starts though capable of consistent form, lacks a recent outing
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 22 starts, though capable of consistent form, notablty in 2023 but also towards  the end of last season; lacks a recent outing

runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: First reserve, has hinted at ability in maidens, not a forlorn hope in handicap company
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in two runs last season; was the subject of a running and riding enquiry when well below that level at this venue on return; mid-field run at Cork since then; not a forlorn hope in handicap company; first reserve.

runners.comment: Second reserve, beat Action Plan at Roscommon, could not be guaranteed to uphold form
runners.spotlight: Gained the eighth win of his career when beating Action Plan at Roscommon two weeks ago; not the most consistent sort, though he achieved back-to-back wins in June 2023; second reserve.

quotes.race: Ardmore Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday was stepping back in trip, which suited him as all he does is stay. He loves to get his own way in front and can go on any ground - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV

quotes.race: BOYLESPORTS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday got a lovely ride from Killian. He has come back to form and you have to take the opportunities when you get them. There's a race at Galway next month which might suit him - Philip Byrne, trainer.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Out On Friday is a tricky ride and has his own ideas. He didn't like going left-handed at Leopardstown last week and loved going right-handed here. He's in again on Sunday and we might take our chance - Philip Byrne, trainer.

runners.comment: Third reserve, now back on the mark off which she won on seasonal debut last June
runners.spotlight: 2-17; now back on the mark off which she won on seasonal debut over 1m1f at Leopardstown last June; ability to run well when fresh is an asset; third reserve.

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Without a win since debut, ran big on seasonal return last year, new yard, check market
runners.spotlight: Debut win at Limerick remains her only success but she has run some big races in defeat in hot handicaps at the Curragh and Leopardstown, including when a close second off 85 on seasonal return last year at the former venue (1m, good); worth a market check on debut for new stable.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We liked Kayhana a lot but she hadn't much done, just a couple of half-speeds. She'd stick her head above water for you going up the Old Vic gallop and I was quietly confident she'd run a big race. She handled conditions well and surprised me with how professional she was considering the amount of work she had done. She'll improve a lot. My only worry was that I'd be too forward on her because she jumps the gates well, so I took her back for a lead. It surprised me how well she quickened. I changed my hands to give her a little flick but didn't need to. There's lots of improvement in her - Chris Hayes, rider

runners.comment: Three time winner including here, shade unlucky latest, chance again off 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner (including at this venue) went close to adding a fourth when an unlucky 0.5l third at Leopardstown last month; should be competitive again off just 1lb higher with Keane booked (on board for last win).

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Nasrullah Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lady Lunette is nearly suited by the sort of race where she runs into trouble. The handicapper gave her a chance today which was a help. She likes a bit of nice ground. We'll probably go to the Galway Mile now - Ray Cody, trainer.

runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 4-19, fit from hurdles but is 4lb above last win, may be on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 4-19 on turf on the Flat; fit from hurdling; last win in this sphere came at Navan off 84 in August (10.5f, gd-yld); no impact off revised mark since and remains 4lb higher than that last success; may need respite from the assessor.

quotes.race: TRM Speedxcell Multi Vitamin And Mineral Tonic Handicap
quotes.quote: Fiver Friday handled the course here from her maiden form  and for her to get her head in front in Ireland is brilliant. They went plenty hard early on and set it up for her - Paul Traynor, trainer.

runners.comment: Won two last year, rated 92 after Listed 4th, poor this term, mark sliding, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year, the second win coming in a 1m Curragh handicap off 74; earned a rating of 92 after a Listed fourth at Naas in October; is back down to 84 after three poor runs this season; not discounted with Foley back on board.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Presence relaxed well today. She got a good tow into the race today and did it well. She wasn't really suited by the track at Bellewstown, she wants a nice track like this one - Keithen Kennedy, rider.

runners.comment: 1-8, good effort latest after slow start, cheekpieces and tongue tie on, could go well
runners.spotlight: 1-8 on turf; won a 12.5f Bellewstown maiden last August; best run since on latest when beaten 1.75l after a slow start and wide trip off 85 at Sligo and 2lb lower now; tongue tie and cheekpieces combo now tried; could go well if getting away on level terms.

runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, good turf run off this mark latest, may not get an easy lead here
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner yet to score on turf but has run well in defeat, including when beaten 1.25l by Fortuna Vera at Leopardstown (1m2f, good) off this mark latest; front runner may not get an easy lead here, could make a bold bid if she does.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Pepper Noir enjoyed going the trip, she travelled better and actually picked up well. I think we will be sticking to this trip and hopefully there is more to come - Gary Carroll, rider.

runners.comment: Won last two, raised 8lb for latest 1m course win, upped in trip, can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Two -time winner for this yard, the wins coming on her last two starts; won off 64 at Dundalk in March (1m) and followed up off 72 here (1m, soft); now 8lb higher; stamina to prove but quicker ground should be fine; can't be discounted in current form.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Pink Oxalis was very impressive. I wasn't too sure beforehand on the ground but she won well over a mile the last day at Dundalk and she's been bouncing at home. She turned a corner and has gotten stronger. Her work had been very good although I wasn't expecting that, she enjoyed the soft ground - Jack Kearney, jockey.

runners.comment: Won a maiden in France, bought for 62,000Euros, may just need this on her stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Vichy (1m2f, gd-sft) for former yard; bought for 62,000Euros at the Arqana sales in December; this is probably her optimum trip and ground but she might just need this first run for her new yard.

runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: 1m course winner, good effort over C&D latest, could go well on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m maiden here on soft in April, making all to win by 6l; ran with credit after rearing up in the stalls over C&D (good) latest; gets the 3yo weight for age allowance and could go well on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Gotomylovely is straightforward but she got stage fright the first day in Dundalk and then ran well in a maiden. The last day wasn't anything to do with her, the bit went through her mouth and she didn't know what to do. I tried to use her experience out in front and she quickened up smartly in the straight. I gave her her own space and she's showed us in her work at home that she quite likes that. There's an engine there - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

runners.comment: No win since April 2023, hasn't looked like ending the drought recently, best on soft
runners.spotlight: Won a Bellewstown maiden (1m, heavy) for Johnny Murtagh in April 2023; no joy since for him or Joseph O'Brien and hasn't looked like ending the barren run in three starts for Paul Flynn; mark sliding and upped in trip but would prefer softer ground.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: 3yo won Naas maiden on return, found Listed too tough latest, can't discount on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: 3yo showed mild promise in two maidens last year; off the mark on seasonal return at Naas in April in a 10.5f maiden (yielding); outclassed in Listed heat back there last month; could do better now tackling handicaps; not discounted for in form stable.

runners.comment: Off the mark at Leopardstown latest, 6lb higher here (1lb wrong) but more to come
runners.spotlight: 3yo built on promise of Curragh fourth over 7f when staying on strongly to see off Pepper Noir at Leopardstown (1m2f, good) last month; is 6lb higher here (1lb wrong) but there could be more to come from this progressive filly.

runners.comment: 3yo, beaten a length in 1m maiden here latest, 6lb wrong, lots more needed back in h'cap
runners.spotlight: 3yo was beaten a length in a 1m maiden here on latest (good); previously beaten 8.5l in a 1m Naas handicap off 75; 6lb wrong here and she needs a lot more off this mark back in handicap company.

racecards.race_name: Ladies Day July 26th (C & G) Maiden

runners.comment: Always at the back first time out at Cork, same over 1m at this venue, can be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Always at the back first time out at Cork; same over 1m at this venue; can be ruled out.

runners.comment: Two fair bumper runs last winter, poor at Clonmel after a break, tongue-tie on now
runners.spotlight: Managed fair efforts in bumpers at Navan and Leopardstown late last year; below that standard at Clonmel last month; tongue-tie on now.

runners.comment: Towards the back in outings at this venue and Limerick in April, makes no appeal
runners.spotlight: Towards the back in outings at this venue and Limerick in April; makes no appeal.

runners.comment: Made a bright introduction when fourth over 1m here last month; form boosted by runner-up
runners.spotlight: Made a bright introduction when fourth over 1m here last month; form boosted by runner-up Pierre Royal; apprentice-ridden here but more appealing than the stable's other runner

runners.comment: Hard to fancy based on his Naas debut, stablemate Ben Lawers has a more obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Hard to fancy based on his Naas debut; Shane Foley aboard, but stablemate Ben Lawers has a much more obvious chance.

runners.comment: Confirmed the ability shown at two with Curragh second on reappearance, stands out here
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in two outings at two, notably when second in a 27-runner contest at the Curragh; split two Ballydoyle newcomers when a beaten favourite at Leopardstown in April (1m2f, good); winner Stay True went on to finish second in Lingfield's Derby Trial; stands out here.

runners.comment: Second foal; dam a 5f handicap winner for this stable; likely to need experience.
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam a 5f handicap winner for this stable; likely to need experience.

runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Towards the rear on seasonal debut, refused to go into the stalls at Cork, gelded now
runners.spotlight: Mild promise on debut last October at Leopardstown (1m, soft); towards the rear at the Curragh on seasonal debut; refused to go into the stalls at Cork; gelded now.

runners.comment: Recovered from a slow start to finish in mid-field at Leopardstown, open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Recovered from a slow start to finish in mid-field on debut in a 1m maiden at Leopardstown; open to improvement.

runners.comment: Dam an unplaced half-sister to Canadian 1m2f Grade 1 winner Blond Me, of some interest
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to an Italian 5f winner; dam unplaced, half-sister to Canadian 1m2f Grade 1 winner Blond Me; of some interest

runners.comment: E150,000 yearling buy, closely related to Group 3 winner Zihba. potentially interesting
runners.spotlight: 150,000Euros yearling; ninth foal; closely related to Group 3 winner Zihba, half-brother to three other winners; potentially interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Beaten 20l when sixth of eight over 1m here on debut, made some late progress.
runners.spotlight: Beaten 20l when sixth of eight over 1m here on debut; made some late progress.

runners.comment: Weak form in four outings at two, can be left out of calculations
runners.spotlight: Weak form in four outings at two; can be left out of calculations.

runners.comment: Second foal, dam a French 1m4f winner with a decent middle-distance pedigree
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam a French 1m4f winner with a decent middle-distance pedigree; one of two newcomers here for the stable.

runners.comment: Brother to four-time winner Solar Wave, dam was of little account but from a good family
runners.spotlight: Brother to four-time winner Solar Wave, half-brother to AW winner Solar System; dam was of little account, but from a good family.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Promising second over 7f here on only start at two, has suffered two reverses this term
runners.spotlight: Promising on only start last season when splitting two market principals in 7f maiden on good at this venue; soft ground may have been his undoing on seasonal debut at Cork; failed to stay 1m5f at Ballinrobe last month.

racecards.race_name: Sonix Entertainment Handicap

runners.comment: Showed more on sole start at two than in maidens at Limerick and Naas this term
runners.spotlight: Showed more on sole start at two than in maidens at Limerick and Naas this term; perhaps premature to write off.

prev_owners.owner: McPeake Investments(NI) Ltd & JP Murtagh Racing

runners.comment: Not a great deal of encouragement from his three maiden outings, stablemate of Ventress
runners.spotlight: Not a great deal of encouragement from his three maiden outings; stablemate of Ventress.

runners.comment: Kept good company in juvenile maidens, may find his level in handicaps this season
runners.spotlight: Kept good company in juvenile maidens; may find his level in handicaps this season; worth a market check.

runners.owner: Charles Kerwin & Brendan Kerwin & Liam Kehoe
runners.comment: Showed some ability in nurseries, stablemate Whats New has had the benefit of a run
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in nurseries; stablemate Whats New has had the benefit of a run.
