runners.comment: Promising seasonal debut when apprentice-ridden fourth at Tipperary, form has been boosted
runners.spotlight: Not a bad run when fifth over 1m at Dundalk in December; made a promising seasonal debut when apprentice-ridden fourth at Tipperary; form has been boosted by wins for the placed horses, Cala Bonita and Coulstys Way.

runners.comment: Feasible he can win in this grade, not far off Gold Dublooms when sixth at this venue
runners.spotlight: Feasible he can win in this grade; not far off Gold Dublooms when sixth at this venue; has to overcome a high draw; tongue-tie on.

runners.comment: 50-1 when down the field on handicap debut here, held by Gold Dublooms, blinkered now
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in three runs at big odds in maidens; 50-1 when down the field on handicap debut here, held by Gold Dublooms; blinkered now

runners.comment: Found 6f inadequate at Naas in her first handicap, massive improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Found 6f inadequate at Naas in her first handicap; maiden form was modest; massive improvement needed.

runners.comment: Fair run when fourth in a claimer here, similar form on handicap debut at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Left his first two runs behind when a 66-1 fourth in a claimer at this venue; similar form when taking same place on handicap debut at Ballinrobe; cheekpieces added now; place chance.

runners.comment: No sign of worthwhile form in maidens, gelded now, top jockey up for first handicap
runners.spotlight: No sign of worthwhile form in maidens, gelded now; top jockey up for first handicap but chance is not obvious.

runners.comment: Last of 15 over 1m at this venue in her first handicap, safely held by Gold Dublooms
runners.spotlight: Last of 15 over 1m at this venue in her first handicap; safely held by third-placed Gold Dublooms; tongue-tie and cheekpieces now.

runners.comment: Of definite interest following third placing on handicap debut, Colin Keane booked now
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maidens; of definite interest following third placing on handicap debut over 1m at this venue; has an edge over Elvetham; Colin Keane booked now, his experience should help to negate any disadvantage from a high draw.

runners.comment: No sign of winning potential in maidens, decent pedigree, may improve with cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: No sign of winning potential in maidens; sister to useful hurdler and Flat winner Casheldale Lad; decent pedigree, may improve with cheekpieces

runners.owner: Barrow Vale Syndicate/A D Mullins/Ms Margaret Mullins
runners.comment: Modest form in three turf maidens, soundly beaten in a Dundalk nursery, up in trip now
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three turf maidens; soundly beaten in a Dundalk nursery; up in trip now, hard to make a case for him.

runners.comment: Nothing in her maiden form provides encouragement, makes handicap debut off a low mark
runners.spotlight: Nothing in her maiden form provides encouragement; makes handicap debut off a low mark.

runners.comment: Has failed to finish closer than sixth in four handicap attempts, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Has failed to finish closer than sixth in four handicap attempts; hard to fancy at this stage; held by Whats New on Tipperary running.

runners.comment: Poor in maidens, last of 12 at Bellewstown on only nursery start; new yard; tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Poor form in maidens; last of 12 at Bellewstown on only nursery start; has changed stable; transformation needed; tongue-tie on.

runners.comment: First reserve, ran her best race so far when fourth at Roscommon on seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in AW handicaps last December; ran her best race so far when fourth at Roscommon on seasonal debut; worth a look if getting a run; first reserve.

runners.comment: Second reserve, mid-division on handicap debut, not as good over a shorter  trip last time
runners.spotlight: Led two out before weakening on handicap debut at Navan, finishing ninth of 19 (1m2f, good); not as good over a shorter trip at Roscommon last time; second reserve.

runners.comment: Third reserve, weak maiden form, only mild promise when ninth of 15 on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Weak maiden form; only mild promise when ninth of 15 on handicap debut at Roscommon; third reserve.

racecards.race_name: Nora Canty Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Plenty of promise in 1m2f maidens for Jessica Harrington but those were in 2022
runners.spotlight: Plenty of promise in 1m2f maidens for Jessica Harrington but those were in 2022 and makes hurdle/stable debut after a long absence; likely best watched.

runners.comment: Third in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle but then struggled in a Downpatrick bumper
runners.spotlight: Third in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle but then struggled in a Downpatrick bumper (again on good); probably vulnerable even if she does reproduce that penultimate effort.

runners.comment: Won her second point by 6l but beat only one home in a bumper at Tipperary 25 days ago
runners.spotlight: Won her second point by 6l but beat only one home in a bumper at Tipperary 25 days ago.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner in Britain; made a quiet debut for this yard on the AW
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m3f when trained in Britain but was sold on for 4,400gns and made a quiet debut for this yard on the AW.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Acca Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: Churchill Rose is a temperamental filly but she has ability. They've played about with her trip but this looks her optimum - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Pana To Milan; dam point winner
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Pana To Milan; dam point winner; unlikely to provide the answer on belated debut.

runners.comment: Insufficient promise in her five points to warrant a second look on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise in her five points to warrant a second look on hurdling debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.comment: Limited signs of winning potential in her five bumpers and likely to be outclassed
runners.spotlight: Limited signs of winning potential in her five bumpers and likely to be outclassed.

runners.comment: Last seen in October when winning a Tipperary bumper for Peter Fahey
runners.spotlight: Last seen in October when winning a Tipperary bumper (good to yielding) for Peter Fahey; that form looks nothing to shout about but an interesting recruit for Gavin Cromwell.

quotes.race: Peppermill Restaurant Nenagh Fillies INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Hillhead Runner got an easy enough lead in front and she stayed at it. She's probably finished up now and will come back over hurdles next year - Peter Fahey, trainer

runners.comment: Comfortable winner of a good-ground bumper here last summer; promising
runners.spotlight: Got stuck in the mud behind Kopek Des Bordes in her first bumper but made light work of her rivals on good ground here last summer; off since but brings lots of potential to hurdling career.

runners.comment: Pointing form doesn't amount to much and was tailed off in a Tramore maiden when 66-1
runners.spotlight: Pointing form doesn't amount to much and was tailed off in a Tramore maiden when 66-1; cheekpieces replace a hood.

runners.comment: Three Flat wins; shaping well over hurdles but vulnerable to anything with potential
runners.spotlight: Three wins on the Flat, two at sprint trips and one at a mile; stays the trip okay over hurdles and could be up to winning a maiden, though will always be vulnerable to anything with potential.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I fancied Mile End in Down Royal the last day but she was drawn 11, missed the kick and never got into the race. Ben [Coen] said he was forced wide all the way, stayed on well and probably wants a mile, but I worked her in blinkers the other day, gave her a sharpener, and they seemed to have brought her alive. It looked like a winnable nursery. She got out there in front, flowing along, and Ben said she did it well - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.comment: Positives to be taken from her first two races on good ground; softer not ideal last time
runners.spotlight: Positives to take from her first two maidens on good ground and a softer surface perhaps not ideal last time; her yard may have brighter prospects with Tequila Talkin'.

runners.comment: Held every chance when falling in maidens here and at Tramore but below par last time
runners.spotlight: Held every chance when falling in maidens here and at Tramore; might have been remembering those incidents when below par at Clonmel; rather watch on the back of that latest effort.

runners.comment: Minor form in two British bumpers and again at Wexford last August; limited appeal for now
runners.spotlight: Minor form in two British bumpers and again at Wexford last August; limited appeal for now.

runners.comment: Had more behind than in front in two good-ground bumpers and should have a future
runners.spotlight: Had more behind than in front in two good-ground bumpers and should have a future over hurdles; however, Hillhead Runner might be the yard's number one hope here.

runners.comment: Had every chance when departing in her point and again on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Would probably have won her first point (yielding) had she not departed late on and was again going well when falling on her hurdling debut at Fairyhouse (soft); that was in October 2023 so has her wellbeing to prove, but clearly not short of talent.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner

runners.comment: Beaten about 3l and 6l respectively in last two maidens so brings each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Better for the fitting of a hood in showing similar sort of form in her last two maidens at Kilbeggan and Tipperary, beaten about 3l and 6l respectively; has each-way claims once more but others preferred for win purposes.

runners.breeder: David Doyle, Edward Doyle Jnr & Ins
runners.comment: Reserve; low-grade Flat maiden who has shown nothing so far over hurdles
runners.spotlight: First reserve; low-grade Flat maiden who has shown nothing so far over hurdles.

runners.comment: Reserve; finished tailed off in a 3m point in late April
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; finished tailed off in a 3m point in late April.

runners.comment: Reserve; half-sister to four winning jumpers; dam unraced
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; half-sister to winners Annie Angel (useful 2m4f-3m chase), Myztique (bumper/2m2f hurdle), Krujers Girl (2m3f-2m7f chase) and Druim Samhraidh (2m chase); dam unraced.

racecards.race_name: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Hammered on hurdling debut at Fairyhouse; blinkers tried
runners.spotlight: Limited promise in points and was hammered on hurdling debut at Fairyhouse; blinkers tried.

runners.comment: Runner-up in one of his bumpers and looked stretched by 3m on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten in five bumpers but was runner-up in one of those at Cork and ran okay there on hurdling debut when perhaps stretched by 3m; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Respectable debut when beaten 4.5l at Tramore and didn't stay 2m6f at Downpatrick
runners.spotlight: Respectable debut when beaten 4.5l at Tramore and didn't appear to stay 2m6f at Downpatrick; now goes in a hood and has a better chance than many in here.

runners.comment: Never remotely dangerous when beaten 27l in a tongue-tie last week at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Never remotely dangerous when beaten 27l in a tongue-tie last week at Ballinrobe.

runners.comment: Always towards the rear on debut in a maiden here on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Always towards the rear on debut in a maiden here on Saturday.

runners.comment: Ninth of 14 and beaten 20l in a good-ground maiden at Killarney 22 days ago
runners.spotlight: Ninth of 14 and beaten 20l in a good-ground maiden at Killarney 22 days ago, finishing just ahead of a below-par Day Trader; that's something to build on.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a Ballinrobe bumper only last week (80-1)
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Ballinrobe bumper only last week (80-1).

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Two quiet runs at Kilbeggan, the latest only yesterday; non-runner.

runners.comment: Flat winner; second only hurdling debut and disappointing next run was just six days later
runners.spotlight: Had plenty of Flat racing in France, winning twice (1m4f on slow ground); bright hurdling debut when second of 18 at Down Royal (2m1f, good) and it was only six days later when disappointing at Killarney; the one to beat on that penultimate effort.

runners.comment: A 3,200euros foal; dam unplaced 2m/2m2f hurdles but related to winning jumpers
runners.spotlight: A 3,200euros foal; dam unplaced 2m/2m2f hurdles, half-sister to winners Themoonandsixpence (useful bumper/2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase), Miss Accurate (bumper/2m hurdle) and Rock's Field (2m6f hurdle); likely best watched.

runners.comment: Huge price when tailed off in a bumper at Thurles; gelded soon afterwards
runners.spotlight: Huge price when tailed off in a bumper at Thurles; gelded soon afterwards.

runners.comment: First foal out of one who was unplaced in bumpers and and over jumps; an unlikely winner
runners.spotlight: First foal out of one who was unplaced in bumpers and over jumps; an unlikely winner.

runners.comment: Regressed on the Flat after a winning debut; tailed off in both runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Regressed on the Flat after a winning debut for the Crisfords; tailed off in both runs over hurdles.

runners.comment: Flat promise in Britain but well beaten in a 1m2f Navan handicap; hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Definite promise during a light Flat career in Britain but still went off 100-1 for a 1m2f soft-ground handicap at Navan (stable debut) and ran accordingly; should enjoy this better ground (provided the rain hasn't arrived) but looks one to watch on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Dam half-sister to winners Too Scoops (useful bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Momus (bumper)
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to winners Too Scoops (useful bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Momus (bumper); would need to see some confidence behind him.

runners.owner: John P Coleman & M J Caffrey
runners.comment: Soon became detached after an early mistake at Cork; went off at 150-1
runners.spotlight: Soon became detached after an early mistake at Cork; went off at 150-1.

runners.comment: Hasn't confirmed his initial promise on the Flat and now has a rating of 64
runners.spotlight: Hasn't confirmed his initial promise on the Flat and now has a rating of 64; however, has some ability and he'll stay the trip over hurdles.

racecards.race_name: Southern Waste Management Mares Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Cork winner in March; beaten under 5l at Kilbeggan last time, staying on
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat and added a Cork handicap hurdle in March (2m, good; 10lb lower); beaten under 5l at Kilbeggan last time, staying on; needs a second look.

quotes.race: Racing Home For Easter Festival April 19th - 21st Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I just tried to settle Ciao Adios a bit and get her into a rhythm and jumping. I wasn't worried where I was as that's the way she has to be ridden. If she gets up there too early she'll do too much early on but she stayed on really well. That's her first win over hurdles and she loves that type of ground - Eoin Kelly, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: In form but gone up 11lb for latest win and her improvement has come over longer distances
runners.spotlight: Arrives here in a fine run of form and could have won her penultimate race had she not crashed out; made all last time at Wexford (2m4f, good) but she's gone up 11lb for that and all her improvement has come over longer distances; expect more positive tactics at 2m.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Mares Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland not winning out of turn and has been to every rodeo this year. Over hurdles, she always seems to bump into a wicked, well-handicapped one. We saw this race coming up a few months ago and when the handicapper dropped her one pound, she was in on rock bottom and I said 'lovely'. She's not the easiest to ride and can be wicked keen, but Richie [Deegan] is the most underrated rider in the country - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

quotes.race: Well Done To Our Irish Cheltenham Winners Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland got the ground she wanted. It's been bottomless wherever we have gone but she likes that sort of heavy ground. It's loose. We'll tip away for as long as we can and see what happens - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

runners.comment: Three-time winning hurdler in Britain on slow ground and rain would be welcomed
runners.spotlight: Three-time winning hurdler in Britain on slow ground and rain would be welcomed; however, signed off for previous yard in modest form.

runners.comment: Off since September but her second in this last year is not her only good run  here
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle/chase winner who was runner-up in this 12 months ago and filled the same position over C&D when last seen in September; goes on all ground and good chance provided she's ready to rock after a lengthy break.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Handicap Chase (Div II)
quotes.quote: It'sallabouteve wants that ground although she has won on soft. Cal gave her a super ride and the 7lb claim helped. She jumped great. She's genuine but needed the ground to come her way - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

runners.comment: Second in her final maiden and she might not be overburdened for this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Bred to get further but she beat all bar an in-form mare in a Tipperary maiden last month (2m1f, good to yielding; first-time hood) and might not be overburdened for this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won three times over hurdles and wasn't beaten all that far last week at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but has won three times over hurdles and wasn't beaten all that far last week at Ballinrobe (2m, good); in the mix.

quotes.race: Sign Up & Save With Fairyhouse.ie Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were confident coming here today. Katherine is an unbelievable jumper and that's a massive help to her. She's been tricky to train and there have been little things we've started to figure out with her - Harry Sexton, jockey.

quotes.race: TipperaryRaces.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Katherine had some good runs in bumpers but we always thought she would be better over hurdles. We like her a lot and we did fancy her today and she handled it really well today. She jumps really well - Harry Sexton, rider.

runners.comment: First two runs were fairly encouraging and should find her level in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in her last two maidens but showed promise in the first and on her bumper debut; should find her level in handicaps.

runners.comment: Beat four rivals at Bellewstown but never threatened to follow up at Downpatrick
runners.spotlight: Only beat four rivals at Bellewstown (2m1f, good) and never threatened to defy the 5lb rise at Downpatrick; still commands some level of respect.

runners.owner: Eoghan Michael Wallis & Gerard Fintan Wallis

prev_owners.owner: Eoghan Michael Wallis & Gerard Fintan Wallis

runners.comment: Respectable form; could be interesting on handicap debut should the rain arrive in time
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in bumpers and again to be second in a Wexford maiden last May; subsequent effort excused on account of good ground (seems to enjoy the mud); could be interesting on handicap debut should the rain arrive in time.

runners.comment: Towards the rear at Clonmel on handicap debut and needs to take a significant step forward
runners.spotlight: Towards the rear at Clonmel on handicap debut and will need to take a significant step forward.

runners.comment: Below par last time but had previously finished second of 18 on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Improved to be second on handicap debut at Naas (2m; 18 ran) but wasn't as good at Tipperary when beaten 15l on the same good to yielding ground; still early days, though, and clearly up to winning races.

runners.comment: Hasn't shown too much thus far, including her handicap debut when a 50-1 chance
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown too much thus far, including her handicap debut when a 50-1 chance.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Long-time absent but has shown enough over hurdles to believe she can win races
runners.spotlight: Useful for Dermot Weld, winning a 1m4f Galway maiden on soft in 2022; has shown enough over hurdles to believe she can win races off this mark; could do with conditions softening up, but even then, has a long absence to overcome.

quotes.race: Sean Cleary Memorial Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Sidiriya is still raw, and I hope there is plenty of improvement in her. Later in the year I expect we could get black type with her in a 1m4f Listed race - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.comment: Maiden who has been chasing; was behind Patty O'Farrell back over hurdles at Tipperary
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has been chasing; finished behind Patty O'Farrell back over hurdles at Tipperary; now tries cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Essentially disappointing since her second outing and was only seventh on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Essentially disappointing since her second outing and was only seventh of 11 on handicap debut; now tongue tied.

racecards.race_name: Join Racing TV With A Free Trial Now Handicap Hurdle

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Jeremiah Nolan

runners.comment: Back to form at Fairyhouse last time; raised 6lb for that but should be competitive
runners.spotlight: Fantastic servant has been brilliantly handled to win seven Flat races (two here) and five hurdles, including several valuable prizes; back to form at Fairyhouse last time and has been raised 6lb for that but should be competitive.

quotes.race: RYBO Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: You'd think Lord Erskine would be getting slower as he gets older and I thought they weren't going fast enough there and I was worried about the ground, but he proved me wrong. He's a great horse to have. I didn't believe he would ever win another race, but he has. He might end up in Punchestown, we'll see. He might go to Killarney for something on the Flat if he's still enjoying it - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Timeless Sash Windows Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about the ground but Darragh (O'Keeffe) said it was no problem. I could never get Lord Erskine into a good race with a light weight and it was the same on the Flat. He'd a proper weight on his back today and there was a good gallop which suited him. His (late) owner Jerry Nolan was a pure gentleman. I rode winners for him and having an owner like him, you couldn't buy them - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Pollardstown Handicap
quotes.quote: We ran Lord Erskine at Listowel the other day and it just didn't work out. He does want two miles and that ground. I stuck the blinkers on him on Friday morning and that made the difference but he loves that ground and the trip. He's just easy to train and he's very laid-back, that's what's wrong with him, he just does what he wants and doesn't kill himself - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Treo Eile Retraining Ireland's Racehorses Handicap
quotes.quote: We had to resort to plan B as Lord Erskine missed the break and had to sacrifice a couple of lengths to get him to the outside, but it worked out thankfully. That is his minimum trip as he is slow, but full of stamina. He was owned by the late Jerry Nolan and I'm delighted for connections - Harry is a big supporter of mine and himself and Miriam work very hard. I'm delighted for them. He is a yard stalwart, loves the track and is as genuine as they come.  - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Run For Your Money Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a decent horse on his day but he's had problems and it's just taken a long time to get him back. He was a bit keen today and the jumping seemed to wake him up a little bit. He handles that ground well and stays well. Hopefully things stay right with him, it's a long time since he won the Irish Cesarewitch here. He'll keep on going over the winter - Harry Rogers, trainer of Lord Erskine

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Event Specialists Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lord Erskine is a nice horse and hopefully he can get another one. He's in again at Clonmel next week so we'll see how he comes out of this - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Strandhill Caravan Park Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's 18 in the ballot at Tipperary but that might bring him up a bit. He'll probably stay over hurdles for a while. He wants a dig in the ground and he wouldn't want it any quicker than that. Hopefully he might end up at Galway and if all goes well he'd scrape into the amateur race - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: He was weak when we got him but he has progressed very well. They went a decent gallop and that suited him. He's a good horse and we might head for the Naas November Handicap next. He does like a good ease in the ground - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: John & Terry Moriarty Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: He wouldn't be in love with the ground but he got away with it. When they get off in front here it seems to be hard to catch them. He's in at Ballinrobe next Thursday over hurdles but he hasn't really taken to hurdles so far. We might be better off keeping him on the Flat and go back over hurdles next year -  Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Sean Cleary Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: He was unlucky in Tramore, Rachael Blackmore gave him a good ride but he was just too free. The plan was always to come here and when Pat Smullen is available, it's a help. He done it well and he's in at Navan on Saturday, where if there's any rain, he'll probably take his chance. The handicapper might give him 5lb or 6lb - Harry Rogers, trainer

runners.comment: A C&D winner last year; excuses last time and can go well if back in top form
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in UK hit form over hurdles last autumn, winning a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle and a valuable C&D handicap, beating Lord Erskine; struggled off higher marks since but not a bad Killarney run last time when coughed and reportedly broke a blood vessel; go well if back in top form.

runners.comment: Leopardstown winner last time; 9lb higher on return but has won when fresh so respected
runners.spotlight: Won handicaps at Kilbeggan, Tipperary and Leopardstown from 2m-2m4f last year, though was disqualified from the first due to a banned substance; 9lb higher on return but has won when fresh so has to be respected, especially if strong in the market.

quotes.race: Midlands National Day Friday 12th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shraheen has been his own worst enemy because he normally races with the choke out but today he relaxed a little better. The strong gallop was a help. He's a lovely big fellow and bred to be a chaser - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.comment: Ran respectably at Killarney on second run this year; is maybe a bit high in the handicap
runners.spotlight: Got loose on intended start at Ballinrobe last week and withdrawn; had earlier run respectably at Killarney on second run this year; is maybe a touch high in the handicap still.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: First Dare had been hitting the crossbar and we were wondering would it ever happen. She got a beautiful ride and these races are determined by the experienced riders. It's great to get a win out of her and a little Flat race is not out of the question further down the line - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.comment: Solid in defeat on last three starts but is creeping up the handicap; should be involved
runners.spotlight: Point winner took a Clonmel maiden on hurdles debut in 2024; solid runs in defeat on last three starts, including on successive days at Fairyhouse; is creeping up the handicap but should be involved again.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The final hurdle was the winning of the race for Stuntman Steve and thankfully he came up for me. We have him six weeks and while he hadn't been away, we thought he was a nice horse so thought he'd go close - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had more letters than numbers in his point-to-point form but he's a grand horse. He won at Ballingarry in May and then made a winning start for us in a maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week when the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. I'm not sure where we go from here but he's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown. I suppose a rated novice could be next for him. 12-11-24

He's a grand horse who won his maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week and the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. He's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown and I suppose a rated novice could be next. 13-11-24

runners.breeder: Flaxman Stables Ireland Limited & R Cantoni
runners.comment: Never involved at Tramore three days ago and has to rebound in a stronger race
runners.spotlight: Won at Wexford and Limerick in the spring and a fine effort at Punchestown since; never got involved at Tramore three days ago, under pressure a long way out; has to rebound in a stronger race.

runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.comment: Won at Clonmel and 3rd at Punchestown; poor on the Flat since but a player back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Some decent form on the Flat without winning; got off the mark over hurdles in a Clonmel maiden in April before a solid third at Punchestown; poor on the Flat since but is a player back in this sphere.

runners.comment: Won a Tramore maiden hurdle last year; beaten 14l at Clonmel last time; needs plenty more
runners.spotlight: Won a Tramore maiden hurdle last August and best run since was when beaten 14l at Clonmel last time; needs plenty more.

quotes.race: Michael Griffin Auctioneers Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mountain Port always worked well but he wants real good ground. We put the cheekpieces on him to help him concentrate and he picked up smartly. He is a horse that can improve away - Paddy Cody, rider

runners.comment: Some solid hurdle efforts in defeat, including at Bellewstown last time; needs  more
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden winner is yet to score in eight hurdle starts but some solid efforts in defeat, including at Bellewstown last time; needs to find a bit more.

runners.comment: Needs to improve to figure but could do that now tackling handicaps; needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in maiden hurdles under exaggerated hold-up tactics; modest in two Flat maidens latest; needs to improve to figure but could do that now tackling handicaps, so needs a market check.

racecards.race_name: John J. Galvin Chase

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin, Gabriel Leenders Et Al

runners.comment: Was runner-up in a Killarney Grade 3 last time; will be difficult to beat on these terms
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle and chase winner, including in a Grade 3 novice in 2024 and later third in a Grade 1; hasn't won since but some fine runs in defeat, including in a Killarney Grade 3 last time; will be difficult to beat on these terms.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We tried new tactics and I thought that might be a help after Punchestown. Paul [Townend] was very taken with Blood Destiny there. He's brilliant to jump, that was always his feature, but we were making too much use of his jumping instead of just using it when we needed it. Coming back in trip might have been a help as well. I don't know whether we've made a mistake now leaving him at home for Cheltenham but at least he has one nice prize in the bag. I imagine he'll probably go for the WillowWarm Gold Cup at Fairyhouse. That was the plan, here and then on to that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet 10 Euro Get 50 Euro Sign Up Offer" Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Blood Destiny was dynamite everywhere and always looking for the next fence really. He's a real chaser. They tried to push me and get him lit up, but I wasn't interfering with him and he was getting a length everywhere with his jumping - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Race Displays Hurdle
quotes.quote: Blood Destiny has obviously improved again from his win at Cork and just has a lovely way of going about it. He was idle enough and missed a couple of hurdles but he was doing nothing - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paul (Townend, rider) had lots of confidence in Blood Destiny, and when he let him stride on he jumped those hurdles well. The experience he got in France helped. He does that nicely in the juvenile division and will make a chaser in time. Hopefully he will go forward. Whether it's too close for him to run at Christmas or not, we'll see. We might wait but will see how he comes out of this. I hope he comes home safe and sound and I'll be planning a Grade 1 route with him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very useful chaser who had a little setback, so you won't see him until after Christmas. We'll do things a little differently to see if he can become a proper Grade 1 horse this season. 25-11-24

He's a very interesting prospect for the Triumph Hurdle having won his two races for us very impressively, particularly last time at Fairyhouse. We didn't run him at the Dublin Racing Festival as it was only three weeks after his previous run and that would have been a big ask for a youngster. Having missed that race, he'll be going over next week a much fresher horse. I think he's very good. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Well beaten in a Limerick claiming hurdle last time; has a lot to find with Blood Destiny
runners.spotlight: Decent sort is a five-time winner including three over fences; well beaten in a Limerick claiming hurdle when last seen and has a lot to find with Blood Destiny even if running up to his rating and that is a big if.

quotes.race: Foxrock Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Embittered won well and it was a nice pot. He had a nice run the last day in Cork, we were delighted with it, and he did it well there today. Carl [Millar] is good value for 7lb. I've no real plan for him, we'll try and find something similar - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Extra Places Everyday At BetVictor Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The extra couple of furlongs helped Embittered. Maybe Roscommon was a bit sharp for him and they got him out of his comfort zone halfway round. Bryan feels something like the Clonmel Oil Chase could suit him. We'll leave that to Eddie, Michael and Joseph, but something like that could suit him. He jumped lovely and I thought he won the race by taking on Exit Poll a long way out. He jumped beautifully the whole way. He tends to jump left at times but he jumped well the whole way. Bryan gave him a lovely ride and suited him well - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Embittered was a decent bumper horse but he was a little bit keen in his bumpers and we've been working on getting him settled. He jumped well and saw it out well. He's in the Royal Bond and it would make sense to go there - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Had some good form as a novice chaser and he will belt away in handicaps. Hopefully he can pick one up somewhere along the line. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in points, bumpers and on chasing debut; out of his depth today
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in points, bumpers and on chasing debut; out of his depth in this company; cheekpieces on.

runners.comment: Below his best on last four starts, including on Flat; a bit to find with Blood Destiny
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner failed to win over hurdles but is a three-time chase winner and has run well in defeat at this track; mostly below his best on last four starts, including on the Flat; a bit to find with Blood Destiny even if back to his best

quotes.race: Co-Op Superstores Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Turning in, I wasn't sure how much Alex (Harvey, on Dollar Value) had left but he stayed going. I didn't think it was over coming to the last. The Banger Doyle doesn't find a whole lot off the bridle as he stays going the same speed so I was trying to keep him on it as long as I could. He seems to be a bridesmaid a lot of the time so he deserved that - Michael O'Sullivan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "5-A-Side" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Banger Doyle is a horse that never runs a bad horse but for some reason he seems to get beaten. He gave an exhibition of jumping. He is still a maiden over hurdles and is rated much lower, so he should be able to win a handicap hurdle - John Queally, trainer.

runners.comment: Has been badly out of form this year and has loads to find in this company
runners.spotlight: Six-time chase winner who goes particularly well at left-handed tracks; however, has been badly out of form this year and has loads to find in this company.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell was able to dictate and got a good ride from Niall. She needed a good jump at the last and nearly gave it away but she got back on an even keel. She will hopefully make a good broodmare down the line - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell is a great servant and hopefully can progress. We're only learning about her best trip. She'll have a little break now and hopefully will turn up in Listowel - Philp Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: She just does enough but Good As Hell is a serious mare to jump, she's always making ground at her fences. She's a nice mare to have and I'm sure there will be more fun to be had with over the summer - Niall Moore, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell might hold her own in this company and she will have one more run as she has been on the go for a while - Philip Fenton, trainer.

racecards.race_name: Beasley Engineering Hunters Chase

runners.comment: Dual point winner won two hunter chases last season; penalised 7lb but has to be respected
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner won two hunter chases last season, at Fairyhouse over 3m and Cork (2m4f); penalised 7lb for those successes but has to be respected.

quotes.race: INHSC Supporting Point-To-Points Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Lisleigh Lad wasn't right last year but was spot on for today. I don't think he'll go back pointing now and we'll stay inside the rails. He's a great jumper. I have two nice four-year-olds for point-to-points, but they're big and backward and won't be running until next year - Eleanor Broderick, trainer.

runners.comment: Three point wins and beat Dundaniel in a Killarney hunter chase last time; 4lb worse off
runners.spotlight: Three point wins from seven starts in that sphere; beat Dundaniel narrowly in a Killarney hunter chase last time despite rider dropping whip; 4lb worse off with that rival but further progress feasible; big player.

runners.comment: Three point wins; close second to Bartlemy Boy in a Killarney hunter chase last time
runners.spotlight: Three point wins and won a Cork maiden hunter chase in 2023; close second to Bartlemy Boy in a Killarney hunter chase last time over 2m7f, staying on; 4lb better off today and extra furlong should help; big player.

runners.comment: Weakened over 3m5f at Downpatrick last time; this trip suit better; not ignored
runners.spotlight: Useful over hurdles and fences at his best for Gordon Elliott; in decent form in open points last season but weakened over 3m5f in a hunter chase at Downpatrick last time; this trip suit better; not ignored.

quotes.race: Thurles Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Vina Ardanza was a bit novicey and was probably a bit better than the short-head he won. He's more a horse for the spring and summer rather than winter heavy ground. He might get a break now and he will improve plenty - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We knew he'd be better over further than two miles. He was just touched off at Naas in November. That was a good run in a competitive race and I'd say he'll run in the Martin Pipe. 19-02-23

runners.breeder: M Armand Lefeuvre & M Yoni Seror
runners.comment: The last of two chase wins came in 2022; decent point runs lately but others preferred
runners.spotlight: The last of two chase wins came in 2022; decent point runs lately but others preferred.

quotes.race: Thurles Racecourse (Q.R.) Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Balkito has been dropped in to his class today. Chasing is his game and Jack got him into a great rhythm. If the handicapper isn't too hard on him he might win another one - Barry Connell, trainer.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a Cork hunter chase but not as good at Killarney last time and has to rebound
runners.spotlight: One time smart hurdle for Noel Meade; runner-up to Lisleigh Lad in a Cork hunter chase but not as good at Killarney last time behind some of these and has to rebound.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Novice Handicap Hurdle Series Final (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Bugs Moran jumped great for him, stayed well and he loves good ground. The trip was a big help to him and he's learning on the job. He's very light and spindly. He jumps well and he'll jump fences too on fast ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.comment: Winner of one of his four point starts; limitations exposed on hunter chase debut
runners.spotlight: Winner of one of his four point starts; limitations exposed on hunter chase debut at Clonmel in January.

runners.comment: Winner of one of three point starts; pulled-up in a Sligo maiden hurdle sole rules start
runners.spotlight: Winner of one of three point starts; pulled-up in a Sligo maiden hurdle sole start under rules; others preferred.

runners.comment: Rated 119 in this sphere and not a bad open point run last week after a lay-off; a player
runners.spotlight: Grade 3 novice hurdle winner at his best but failed to win over fences in 17 starts; still rated 119 in this sphere and not a bad open point run last week after a lay-off; hood added and a player.

quotes.race: BetVictor Casino "Monksfield" Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He travelled easy during the race and was probably doing a little bit too much. He relaxed coming out of the back straight and I wasn't in a rush with him as I knew he'd come home well. When we jumped the third last they quickened and I probably got caught for a bit of toe but once we hit the rising ground he started to hit top gear. I knew jumping the last we had a good chance as the horse in front had been keen. Stamina is his thing and he did well to win over two miles. We always knew with a step up in trip that he would improve - Keith Donoghue, rider of Fakiera

quotes.race: Glenview And Rathbarry Stud Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fakiera was entitled to win a maiden hurdle on his form and he'll come on plenty for that - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: The National Hunt Chase is a possibility for him, or else the Kim Muir. We'll decide nearer the time. He was disappointing in the Thyestes but is better judged on his run in the Porterstown at Fairyhouse. 19-02-23

runners.comment: Modest point maiden was well beaten when falling at Killarney last time; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Modest point maiden was well beaten when falling at Killarney last time; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Is 1-11 in points; limitations exposed in winners' company and a lot on his plate today
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-11 in points; limitations exposed in winners' company and has a lot on his plate today.

runners.comment: Record of 1-9 in points; tailed-off in a Punchestown banks race last time;  look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 1-9 in points; tailed-off in a Punchestown banks race last time; hood added; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Point winner in March was runner-up in a winners' race since but  disappointing last time
runners.spotlight: Point winner in March was runner-up in a winners' race since but was disappointing last time; a lot on his plate today.

runners.comment: Just 1-21 over fences but lots of good runs incl' in 2024 Scottish National; considered
runners.spotlight: Just 1-21 over fences but lots of good runs including when beaten only 7l in 2024 Scottish National for Willie Mullins; hasn't matched that form since, including for this yard but still considered.

quotes.race: JT McNamara Ladbrokes Munster National Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's my first time riding Ontheropes, and in fairness he was very straightforward. He got away well, had a little peck at the first but after that he jumped super everywhere. I was always comfortable, I had a lovely position, and I was conscious not to let him try to sprint too much. I built it up from the top of the hill and he was good at the last and he was always holding on a bit - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good in the Munster National on his first start after a break. His aim is the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury and it's so far so good in terms of his preparation. 02-11-21

His runs have been okay and he needs to hit better form. He is another who does not appreciate the heavy winter ground. He won the Munster National well and is a proper staying chaser so these are the races I will be entering him in over the next couple of years. 09-03-22

runners.comment: Won a Cork maiden hunter chase and decent thirds twice since; has to step up again
runners.spotlight: A record of 2-5 in points; won a Cork maiden hunter chase on rules debut over this trip and posted decent thirds at Punchestown and Downpatrick since; has to step up again.

racecards.race_name: Bryan MacMahon (Pro/Am) Flat Race

runners.comment: Runner-up last time; has a 7lb penalty but this isn't a strong race and he is a big player
runners.spotlight: Won a Punchestown bumper on debut in 2023; was then off for a year before running respectably in two winners' bumpers; back after another year off when an 8l runner-up at Tipperary last time; carries a 7lb penalty but this isn't a strong race and he is a big player.

runners.comment: Point winner has the ability to go close but questions after an absence;  market can guide
runners.spotlight: Was a 6l Punchestown point winner on heavy in February 2024 on second start in that sphere; sold for 160,000GBP pounds after; the runner-up in that point won a maiden hurdle ater and is rated 109; has the raw ability to go close but questions after an absence; the market can guide.

runners.comment: Pulled up in a point; comes from a useful family and is surely better than that run
runners.spotlight: Started 5/2 fav' for a point in March but made mistakes and hampered, pulling up; comes from a useful dual-purpose family and is surely better than that run; the market can guide.

runners.comment: Beaten 55l in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle and is best watched reverting to a bumper
runners.spotlight: Weak in the market on recent debut in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle and beaten 55l; best watched reverting to a bumper.

runners.comment: A 7l runner-up in a point last time after a year away; will need to improve a fair bit
runners.spotlight: The best of three point starts was latest when a 7l runner-up four weeks ago on return after a year away; will need to improve a fair bit from that but is possible.

runners.comment: Beaten 13l in a point in March on soft ground; will have to do a lot more on bumper debut
runners.spotlight: The best of three point starts when beaten 13l in March on soft ground; will have to do a lot more on bumper debut.

runners.comment: Beaten 24l in only completed point from three starts; will have to do much more
runners.spotlight: Beaten 24l in only completed point from three starts; will have to do much more to score on bumper debut.

runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper in 2020; pulled-up on return over hurdles; can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper in 2020; pulled-up on return over hurdles recently; can't be fancied.

runners.comment: Late-starter but is by the champion NH sire so is worth checking for market strength
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; closely related to point winner Gift And Glory; dam unraced half-sister to bumper and useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner I Hear A Symphony; late-starter but is by the champion NH sire so is worth checking for market strength.
